jcr:content.jcr:title: United Kingdom in the Eurovision Song Contest 1959

contentheadline.headline: United Kingdom in the Eurovision Song Contest 1959

contentrichtext.text: {{ESC National Year | Year = 1959 | Country = United Kingdom | Preselection = [[Eurovision: Your Decision|A Song For Europe]] | Preselection date = '''Semi-finals'''<br>2 February 1959<br>5 February 1959<br>'''Final'''<br>7 February 1959 | Entrant = [[Pearl Carr & Teddy Johnson]] | Song = [[Sing, Little Birdie]] | Final result = 2nd, 16 points }} The '''[[United Kingdom]]''' held a national preliminary round to choose the song that would go to the [[Eurovision Song Contest]] 1959. The semi-finals were held on February 2 and February 5, 1959 and the final was held on February 7, 1959. All were presented by [[Pete Murray (disc jockey)|Pete Murray]]. ==A Song For Europe 1959== ===Semifinal 1=== {| class="wikitable" |- ! Draw !! Artist !! Song !! Finalist |- | 1 || [[Marion Keene]] || "I'll Be With You" || NO |- bgcolor="ffdead" | 2 || '''[[Pearl Carr & Teddy Johnson]]''' || '''[[Sing, Little Birdie]]''' || '''YES''' |- bgcolor="ffdead" | 3 || '''Glen Mason''' || '''Suddenly''' || '''YES''' |- | 4 || Don Rennie || "How Could I Know" || NO |- bgcolor="ffdead" | 5 || '''Steve Martin''' || '''One Lonely Heart''' || '''YES''' |- | 6 || Sheila Buxton || "Love Me, Love Me" || NO |- |}<ref name="Songs4Europe">http://www.songs4europe.com/3.html</ref> ===Semifinal 2=== {| class="wikitable" |- ! Draw !! Artist !! Song !! Finalist |- bgcolor="ffdead" | 1 || '''[[Lita Roza]]''' || '''This Is My Town''' || '''YES''' |- | 2 || Lester Ferguson || "This I Will Tell You My Son'' || NO |- | 3 || [[Pearl Carr & Teddy Johnson]] || "That's It, That's Love" || NO |- | 4 || Rosemary Squires || "Cha Cha Chocola" || NO |- bgcolor="ffdead" | 5 || [[John Hanson (musician)|John Hanson]] || "Success Song" || '''YES''' |- bgcolor="ffdead" | 6 || Valerie Shane || "Oh, Oh, Reckon I Must Be In Love" || '''YES''' |- |}<ref name="Songs4Europe"/> ===Final=== {| class="wikitable" |- ! Draw !! Artist !! Song !! Place |- bgcolor="ffdead" | 1 || '''[[Pearl Carr & Teddy Johnson]]''' || "[[Sing, Little Birdie]]" || 1st |- | 2 || Glen Mason || "Suddenly" || 3rd |- | 3 || Steve Martin ||" One Lonely Heart" || 4th |- | 4 || [[Lita Roza]] || "This Is My Town" || 2nd |- | ? || John Hanson || "Success" || ? |- | ? || Valerie Shane || "Oh, Oh, Reckon I Must Be In Love" || ? |- |}<ref name="Songs4Europe"/> "[[Sing, Little Birdie]]" won the national and went on to come 2nd in the contest. ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== *[http://web.archive.org/web/20091026223355/http://geocities.com/national_finals_50s_60s/UK1959.html UK National Final page] {{UK in Eurovision}} {{Eurovision Song Contest 1959}} [[Category:United Kingdom in the Eurovision Song Contest]] [[Category:Countries in the Eurovision Song Contest 1959]] [[Category:1959 in the United Kingdom|Eurovision Song Contest]]
